module.name: additive_manufacturing_part_and_build_information
module.name.french: Information de construction des pièces par fabrication additive

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the definition of additive manufacturing part and build information.

For example, additive manufacturing processes require that a build orientation be specified so that the resulting part has the required physical properties, surface finish, geometric accuracy, and definition of support geometry. Placement of the part within the additive manufacturing system build volume might also be specified. This requires the definition of build plate and volume geometry.

inscope.li: definition of the part build orientation and placement on the build plate;
definition of the available build volume of the additive manufacturing machine as a bounding box;
providing mechanism to distinguish between the support structure geometry and the part geometry.

outscope.li: definition of heterogeneous materials, lattice structures and additive manufacturing Product and Manufacturing Information (PMI);
detailed definition of the additive manufacturing workplan.

usage_guide.p: Additive manufacturing is a layered manufacturing process. ISO/ASTM 52900:2015 "Standard Terminology for Additive Manufacturing" defines seven Process Categories for additive manufacturing: binder jetting, directed energy deposition, material extrusion, material jetting, powder bed fusion, and sheet lamination. Polymer, metallic, and ceramic materials are used in additive manufacturing. To prepare CAD geometry for a specific additive manufacturing process, build orientation, build placement, and support geometry can be specified. The standard allows for the specification of a build orientation and build placement relative to the build surface of the additive manufacturing process. It also specifies the relationship between the build plate, supports, and workpiece.
